alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 10:36AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Moffat County through 1115 AM MDT... At 1035 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 31 miles northeast of Dinosaur, or 51 miles east of Vernal, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Moffat County, including the following locations... Greystone. This includes Colorado 318 between mile markers 27 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin
